CatDescriptText: Mrs. Geneva Dennis, presser, North Side and Mrs. Mabel Carlo, housewife, Third Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 25, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "Do you think Federal aid to schools should be granted to parochial as well as public schools?" Mrs. Dennis' answer reads: "I think they should, because it would help integration."  Mrs. Carlo's answer reads: "Sure, I would help them, because the Government has more money than the churches."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Geneva Dennis wearing dark cross hatch patterned coat, light colored head scarf, and dark gloves, standing on sidewalk, Downtown; Portrait of Mabel Carlo wearing flecked coat with bottom button unfastened, standing in front of building, Downtown
